text: was in there las night for dinner with 10 friends of mine our server was amazing everything was great the service was good the food was good and we had good time we are here for the rodeo and just want to give a shout out to iris for such great service

Liked the music and atmosphere.  Food wasn't bad service sucked.  I worked plenty of restaurants and to watch four servers and a host all gathered in the entrance having a "great time" while my whole table sat with empty drinks just doesn't have a good impression on this restaurant for my first experience.

How can it continue to get worse month after month. Having gone here for ages you can tell things have changed cook wise. The seafood can go from great to rancid tasting in the same week. Why?  The new menu has scallops that are truly dreadful. It takes someone that eats scallops to cook them right I think. Crab stack has more mayonnaise and seasoning to cover any hint of crab flavor.  And still steaks 2 out of 3 times we've ordered have been not slightly but very over cooked and dry. I'm not a big fan of the Mexican restaurant next door but go there now for a steak instead when we stay at SAMs.  Think I'll try the standard TGIFridays food next time.  Probably more consistent anyway.  Too bad. Was once a great place to dine.

Not worth a 1 star rating.  For the price you pay, we will not be back.  We have dined there many times before with everything being great.  Starting with the spinach salad having slimy leaves, not wilted from the dressing.  This was replaced with haste from the Mgr who wanted to argue that we didn't know what a hot dressing  over spinach salad should look like.  Wilted is one thing, slimy leaves after date is another.  The salmon did not come seasoned as described, the shrimp scampi was vermicelli and shrimp, not sauteed garlic in sauce.  Maybe the chef had an off night?  $175 tab, and less than stellar food with rude Mgr?  Don't waste your time.

This was the perfect place to dine as we stayed at Sam's Town for our 1 year anniversary.   

This place has a somewhat of a western lodge/cabin feel. The service was good, our waiter checked on us often. Prices were average.  I ordered the crab cakes, and it was okay.  My husband liked his steak, and said it was cooked perfectly.  The bread basket was probably my favorite thing.

We made reservations here for mothers day, it had been a good 4 years since our last visit to Billy Bobs. Let me say it was not as pleasant as I had remembered. The waiter who brings the drinks stood over me passing..let me re phase that he was slamming down the drinks for 6 of us standing next to me the entire time. It felt like I was in his way. It took asking three times to get a refill for my husbands diet coke. We got plenty of water refills but the guy just couldn't remember that diet coke. Then the food waiter wasn't so friendly. My mother in laws steak was supposed to be well done and it had plenty of red in it and she doesn't like to make a fuss so she ate around it and when waited asked how our food was she said well my steak wasn't well but I did eat around it. He never apologized or offered to take it back or even tried to make it right. He could care less. I don't really know why he even bothered to ask that question. Out of habit I guess. At the end of the meal he brought our check and smiled. Wow smiling at the beginning of the experience would have went alot farther for me. The steaks where not very good and we all decided that we wouldn't be coming back to Billy Bobs, sad because my husbands family use to come there alot for birthdays and graduations and special events. But when you get bad service and bad food well what is left?

Dont go here!!. This place practices sex/gender  discrimination!!  As a preface, they have no dress code posted.  They said my atire (a female) with tank top, shorts, and sandals was fine. However, my husband, who was dressed exactly the same (tank top, shorts, sandals) was not "wearing appropriate atire" and not allowed to dine. When we asked for the written dress code, and they said tgey had none. I pointed out there was no dress code posted at the business or on the web, and not to mention it was over 100 degrees outside, and in the desert, the manager became rude. Isnt this discrimination based on sex/gender? Dibt eat at this place if you belueve in civil rights, because they don't.

We went for Christmas Day Dinner on December 25th, hoping for a wonderful meal with family. It turned out quite the opposite.  We had made an early reservation(445pm)  over a week in advance, since 6pm was already taken. We were seated on time and the restaurant was only 1/3 full. Our server was nice and came by to get drink orders. Then we waited a long time to order our meal.  When she finally came back to take our order, she apologized and said she thought we had a larger party.  We had 4 adults and one toddler.  We placed our order and  were served our soups quickly. The soups were good.  2 of us ordered Steak Dinners and 2 ordered the holiday Turkey Dinner.  The turkey dinners were good.  However, the steaks were both over cooked!  I ordered Medium and it was well done. My MIL ordered Medium Rare and it came out medium well to well.  It took a long time to get our meals.  We asked the server for the Manager.  The Manager finally came by the table.  He was a tall heavy set man who towered over the table and made us feel small.  His bottom button on his short sleeved shirt was unbuttoned.  We told him that our 2 steaks were over cooked, but that the yams were yummy ( best part of the meal.). He proceeded to say: " cut into the middle, maybe that's cooked right".  As if to say, we, as the customers were wrong.  We said it was well over cooked and we did not like it.  He only said Sorry, and offered nothing... No discount, no dessert, nothing.  Just sorry.  Sadly, we will not return and will be letting all our friends to stay away.  Did Management change here?  My MIL said it used to be good a few years back.  The manager was very  unkept and not nice at all.  We will look elsewhere for better food and hospitality.  I' d expect more from Management.  I'm just sad that he was of no help, and it ruined our holiday Dinner!

Disgusting and overpriced.  I don't mind paying for a great steak but this was terrible so much that I had to rush home and use the restroom (Sorry to be graphic).  It gave me food poisoning.  My stomach is still in pain as I write this review!

***The server was nice though!
This is the best kept secret in Vegas, everything is good from the food to the exceptional staff! Thumbs up, oh yea I threw my wedding party here.

Wife and I had a great dinner here.  She got the early bird special and I got the ribs and lobster.  The wait staff was attentive and friendly.  The food was cooked perfectly.  We both had the potato soup.  She got the sweet potato, which was fantastic.  My baked potato was a little plain.  And the bill only came to $50.  Highly recommended.

The steaks here are really good. Not quite the quality as a lot of other steakhouses in town. For the price it can't be beat though. The pork chops are some of the best I have ever had. They are properly cooked and are a very thick cut. Plus you get two of them. You just might have to take one home when you can't finish both. If you only got the pork chops you might be able to eat both, but you also get a salad and one side. The sides are very large. Especially the baked potato. That could be a meal in itself. And speaking of the salad, it is very, very good. They have a mixture of iceberg, mixed greens, onions, olives and croutons. And the dressing is put on the side allowing you to decide how much goes on. They also put out a nice bread basket with several types to choose from.

The service is always the best here. They are very attentive to all the patrons needs. When they get very busy service can be a bit slow sometimes, but they still do pretty good.

The decor has some needed work. It looks like the design was selected in the sixties and never redesigned. It feels like you are eating in a barn or a mine shaft depending where you sit. A bit of a more modern take might make the ambiance more appealing.

Friday night, no reservations, quoted a wait time of 20 minutes....not bad.  Until we were seated that is.  The place was next to empty, not exactly sure why we had to wait 20 minutes for a table as there were plenty empty tables that were visible.  
Our waiter approached the table, engaged in a little conversation, and even complimented our children.  He was great, until the larger party sat next to us(8+ people).  Salads came out (these were probably the best part of the dinner, but you could probably get the same quality at apple-bee's)  Once our entrees came out, the kids chicken was rubber-like (not worth $15.00 a plate).  My husband and I both ordered steak (ordered medium, presented well done, no pink and completely dry) with a side of shrimp (4 overcooked pieces of shrimp for $11, YUCK!)  Our waiter was so focused on the larger party, he only acknowledged us in passing.  This made it nearly impossible to inform him of how dissatisfied with our food we were.  When our plates were cleared, the waiter asked if I wanted a box, I said no thank you, the dinner was not good at all.  He cleared the plates and left.  Another gentleman who had taken our drink order came back to ask if I wanted a refill on soda, I said yes.  Unfortunately, he never returned with my drink.  The waiter put our bill on the table, and took it back in passing, before I was ready to acknowledge the amount of $115.  

He was not interested at all in hearing what we had to say. I wrote on the back of the order slip all of the issues we had and handed it directly to the manager that was at the door, and proceeded to stand right outside Billy Bob's to watch the mystic waterfall show.

The manager did call me the next day.  I wish I could say he handled the situation the best he could; however, that was not the case.  He said he spoke with the waiter (who stated he was unaware of any issues).  He also stated that had I informed him of the problem earlier, he could have made an effort to make an adjustment to our bill.  

Needless to say, this place is a joke.  We just moved to Vegas, and are looking for a good steak joint that is NOT on the strip.  I guess we will continue our search... elsewhere!

This is located in Sam's Town Hotel/Casino on Boulder hwy.  I've heard good things about Billy Bobs from my daughter who attends UNLV and also from relatives who frequent the area.  Went there for the 5pm - 6pm early bird special which is prime rib for $12.99.  My wife and I got there right when they opened (5pm) and didn't have to wait at all.  Waiters were extra friendly and attentive, making us feel like regulars even though it was our first time here.  The ambience was cozy and comfortable, maintaining that "ol' west" feel which is throughout the casino.

As for the food:  I got my prime rib med/rare with sweet potato as my starch.  The piece was perfectly med/rare and fairly lean.  It was soft and flavorful.  The sweet potato was huge, soft, and delicious also.  I was a happy camper.
The wifey got the 1/2 rack bbq ribs with a baked potato for $18.00.  The meat was soft and the sauce was "on the sweet side."  She did say that the sauce could have been warmer.  Nonetheless, she was satisfied with her meal (And if mama's happy, I'm happy).
The dinner salad was a bit disappointing being that they used iceberg lettuce.  I did not expect that from a restaurant of this caliber.

All in all I'll give the thumbs up.  BUT only for the early bird price I paid.

Every time I've stayed at Sam's Town I have always had a steak dinner here. The steaks have always been great tasting at a reasonable price. The service is good. I'm surprised to see some negative reviews. I am actually planning on visiting Las Vegas this coming weekend with my family and I do plan on eating at Billy Bob's to have my steak dinner. Love this place!

Really would not call this a high class place the food was not so good.  My lemonade had something floating in the bottom of the glass but first I order a lemonade and received an ice tea with lemon I knew then wrong place that was the simple order...my husband order salmon...they sat out bread and salsa chips with butter but you get no salsa just the chips lol..then for the salad for those of you who like the heart of the lettuce this is your place he asked for no cucumber which he did not get but it came with the tomatoes and olives well let me correct that the one cherry tomato and the two olives...and for the meal rice pilaf was on half of the tomato garlic mashed potatoes were so dry you could use it to start a paper machete or toss it and knock someone upside the head with it.  The portion size well don't expect to get full the price expect to be pissed off...and you do not know how much unless you ask before you order no prices on the menu his bill with my glass of lemonade which us all I had was 31.65. I went to mcdonalds it cost me 2.50 lmao and I was full

Came here for the 14.95 steak and lobster special. It was good, a little too much fat on the sides for me but I enjoyed it. The mashed potatoes were great, and so was our waitress toni. I really enjoyed the restaurant and the location. The sams town atrium is really neat.

Being Vegas residents, we frequent Sam's Town. One Monday eve we decided to pop into Billy Bob's. We were greeted by a short, stout dark haired wench who barked" Do you have a reservation? We politely responded "Well, no we don't", as we gazed at the multitude of empty tables. After being informed it would be an hour before we could be seated, we hopped over to Willy and Jose's, after all we are in the Easter spirit. I wouldn't even wait an hour to have sex with Rihanna who I am sure is much hotter and juicer than anything they serve.  Fabulous service and food at Willy's, and the cash flowed from our hands to theirs. Even had a front row seat to the laser light show, yawn. Off to see our friends the one arm bandits, oh and five dollar bills kept falling onto the cocktail waitress' platter. The moral of the story is... don't hire anyone whose customer service skills and IQ total less than a potential customers wallet!

I'm a frequent diner at Billy Bob's but I must say my dinner this past Saturday was the WORSE dinner I have ever had. Our potatoes were cold the vegetables weren't cooked and our steak! I swear I thought they got a new chef because it was horrible! A complete waste of money. I'm very disappointed in Billy Bob's.

Great meal. Great service. Nice atmosphere. Waiter Jonathan and our Busboy were very attentive.  Lobster tail and steak dinner for $24 was filling and delicious. Steak was a little more cooked than I thought it would be. Good experience.

Dined on Sunday, August 9th, 2015, 8pm
We were there on a coupon from Sam's Town. Picked the Steak Diane, lobster bisque soup and salad, baked potato. The only complaint was the salad. For a restaurant with up-scale prices to throw some bagged iceberg lettuce, a few cucumber sluces and grape tomatoes on a plate and call it a salad was disappointing to say the least.
The soup was delicious, the steak medalions so tender and the mushroom gravy very savory. The steak was served atop asparagus and  a few wilted microgreens. They should switch them and use them in the salads instead.
We shared a silky creme brule for dessert. It was large enough for two and a bargain at only $6.

Terrible. Was treated by a salesman who obvioisly had no taste. Sirloin was tenderized to oblivion and absolutely drowned with sauce making it so salty. i should've sent it back, but hey I wasn't paying. Also atmosphere was so dark, couldn't really see that well.

I can't say I was thrilled with Billy Bob's Steakhouse, but its probably because i ordered the wrong dish: Coconut Chicken Tenders...definitely not a great combination. Service was great, our waiter Toni was a total sweetheart. Virgin strawberry margaritas are delish (a little on the tangy side, just the way I like it). I feel like the menu was a little lacking...perhaps I'm just not cut out to be a meat and potatoes girl.

Wow ! what can I say this was probably the best Ribeye I have ever had & I am a big big fan of Ribeye !  Unreal...Great service @ the bar with Daryl !   Awesome sweet potato & a wonderful single malt Scotch made this one of my favorite I'm a long time !  Definitely a must !

This is the very first place I tried when I started eating at what I considered to be an "upscale" restaurant at the time. I actually thought it was expensive at around $140 for 2 people. 

This is also the first place that I tried escargot, so they will always have a special place in my heart. So far I've tried the blackened ribeye (my favorite), the lamb chops, and the filet Mignon. 

My wife always orders the blackened ribeye. I think she's trying to figure out who in Vegas has the best ribeye. So far T-Bone's Chophouse holds that title.

Guys, if you've never taken your girl out to a really nice restaurant to eat and you think Olive Garden is upscale, try this place out. Its a guaranteed step up and will earn you a bunch of cool points.

If you eat out regularly and haven't been here yet, check it out because they have an awesome menu and its not too pricey compared to some of the nicer restaurants we've eaten at.

billy bobs inside sams town...bit of a hike to get there, but it was well worth the trip.  i had the porterhouse, med rare, it was juicy and flavorful, cooked a bit past med rare, but not enough for me to cause a ruckus... it was big and i finished it all.  had baked potatoe and asparagus to go with the hunk of cow.  potatoe was great and there was plenty of aspargus, cook perfectly, not too mushy or to firm...just right.
i can still smell and taste the steak as i write this.
my bro had the 12 ounce filet, it looked really good, he didnt talk much, so it appeared to make him happy.  
if your lookin for something off the beaten track, check out billy bobs.
the staff was great and very attentive, and the joint was packed for a thursday nite.
will certainly go back next time im in sin city

Billy Bob was great. They have a big portion sizes and great services. We were in a group of 17 and the waiter was fantastic. I would recommend Billy Bob's to any want who might be looking for a great steakhouse.

This restaurant is located inside the Sam's Town casino. 

Ask for the Prime Rib Special! It's not in the menu, but if you're there between 5pm and 6pm you can order it. 

Prior to arriving, the party I was with informed me that service here isn't exactly quick or top notch, but if you go there knowing that then at least you know what to expect. 

The waitress did take a while to get our drinks. Our drinks didn't arrive until after our salads came out. Then she forgot one persons drink in our party. He had to remind her to get his drink. She blamed it on the bartender being "busy". We all thought that was odd because it was barely 5pm and the place was practically empty. Literally, aside from our party, the others dining in the restaurant were elderly folks drinking water and ice tea...

We all ordered the Prime Rib Special. It was AMAZING!!! My piece of meat was really thick and juicy. My baked potato was huge and piping hot. I'm also a fan of their ranch dressing. 

I didn't think the service was nearly as bad as my friends made it sound. Aside from the slow drinks, our waitress was very nice and quick when I asked for stuff. I'd go again for that special. For that reason, I'm giving it 4 stars.

Sam's Town for a week, comp food so...but Billy Bob's lamb was off the hook, perfectly cooked and perfectly seasoned, soft, no smell, no off taste, so good..other steaks were ok...pimpkin cheesecake was really good...definite repeat..service is great and not iverly attentive.
food was great went today for my birthday everyone there are nice and friendly and our server Matt was really good, very nice to us.Made my Birthday great!

Torn... First time i came, it was great!  Second time, well, my family and i were beyond frustraded and upset.  We had made an early reservation and were seated right away.  Our orders were taken and then we waited, and waited, and waited.  Almost 30 min had gone by, and nothing!  We asked out waitress what was going on, and she blamed in on a private party of 60! ok, well i get that, but they should have been better prepared, especially for a Sat. night!  We waited another 10 min, and still nothing, and then we were able to talk to the manager, who i will say was the most rude and unprofessional i think i have ever come across.  She showed no remorse or care that we had been sitting there for almost an hour and received nothing on our table! We complained and she pretty much argued with us!  The whole thing was just terrible, we will NEVER be back!
I had some of the best food ever! Prices are terrific. .. I've paid more money at other places and the food wasn't  1/2 as good.  Our server was fantastic!

Good eats in a rootin' tootin' yet easy and elegant cowboy atmosphere. I went vegetarian on this trip, which I know is like going to an Italian restaurant and ordering a burger.   My date enjoyed a fabulous rib eye and shared a couple of bites with me, so I can attest to the high yum-quotient of the cow flesh served here.  Nevertheless, as I said, I went vegetarian and ordered the onion soup, warm spinach salad and baked sweet potato.  Each one was fabulous and thoroughly satisfying.  Not as expensive as most steak houses in town (probably because it is NOT located on the Strip).   Highly recommended for carnivores and veg-heads alike!
Terrible service, closing early during rodeo week, fire the awful management!  Truly unreal, walk in at 9:45, no one to help you, finally find someone and they are a complete idiot!

Place was pretty empty and service was pretty bad. Even had to clear my own plates on to another table that was not clean, because I hate dishes left in front of me or off to the side when I'm done. Busser saw me and said thank you...lol. My filet was overdone and dry as a bone. Glad I didn't pay for this meal since I was comped. :(

This is an updated review from July 4th weekend 2015, which was my third time here. The food was great as always but the service this time was lackluster and quite obnoxious to say the least. It was 4th of July weekend so the restaurant was more packed than my previous times here. My server was "Maverick" (really?), an older gentleman with an obviously fake Old Western stage name. He tried to tell my friends and I bad jokes the few times we saw him and kept loudly laughing at himself and also tried to hard sell us about 3 times into buying some "funnel cake fries" when we kept saying we were not interested! It took him 20 minutes to bring our initial drinks and another 20 to come back and even take our order! The food was great when it finally arrived but he then never checked on us again until we got the check. We have never before had such a poor experience at this place so I am chalking it up to (hopefully) the crazy busy holiday weekend. When I return I will make sure it is not a holiday and hopefully I will get a different server!

We ate dinner here twice, and I'd give it 3.5 stars. The 20-ounce bone-in prime rib was supposed to be medium rare the first night and came out medium well, but it tasted good. The second night was much better. Our server on the first night was great, helpful and friendly. The server on the second night was mediocre, and took very long to bring everything, including the drinks. 

The king crab legs on the first night were good, better than the second night. Somehow the crab legs in the appetizer were served cold and tasted like they were split open before they were cut, since they had zero taste. The ones that came as a side dish were warm and tasty but a little salty. The clam chowder was delicious. The lobster bisque and French onion soup were okay, although there was a little tool much Pernod in the bisque. I guess that's how they serve it in Vegas?

Overall I can't complain, since we were treated to dinner by my cousin and her husband. Thank you for a nice dinner and great company!
I had the bone in rib-eye. Very good. Cooked perfectly.  The sides were great too. Dessert was even better. Will return.

I was not impressed, at all.  Overpriced, under seasoned ribeye needed A1 steak sauce just to choke it down.  Server "Mavrick" knew his stuff, but tried too hard to be a comedian.  I would NOT recommend this place to anyone.

We went for Valentines Day and shocking enough we got a same day 
Reservation with opentable. The server was Matt and he was so nice. We had drinks and wine to start and the bread basket was warm and fresh and the butter was soft and a tiny bit salty (which is how it should be and how we like butter) we started with the fire and ice platter but we were not crazy about the cold crab legs or the grilled shrimp. The tempura shrimp and oysters were excellent. We ordered a 1/2 dozen more. Theni had lobster bisque which was perfect and hubs had tomato mozzerella salad. He said just a bit to much basil. For dinner I had 8oz filet with bernaise sauce galic mashed potatoes and garlic asparagus. Hubs ordered ribeye mid rare but it was over cooked so he got mid rare primerib and he loved it. He also had garlic mash and the asparagus was big enough that we shared. For dessert we shared the chocolate bombay. It was rich and full of yummy chocolate mousse. All in all it was a perfect evening. We sat on the patio and go to semi see the light show and hear the music.

So date night was upon us and my better half had a hankering for steak. Courtesy of the Yelp Iphone application, good ol' Billy Bob's inside of Sam's Town popped up. 

Nestled in the Sam's Town "forest" near the indoor waterfall and light show, we arrived at Billy Bobs. 

The hostess politely ended her personal phone call to find out whether we preferred a booth or table then proceeded to escort us to our seats. 

I couldn't tell you our server's name if that is any indication as to the level of spectacular service we received last night, but luckily the tasty eats balanced out the lack of charisma from our wait staff. 

House salad with "Italian" dressing was actually quite tasty! But for the record they may want to just refer to it as a balsamic dressing..either way it was delicious. 

I ordered the breaded chicken with lemon caper sauce and what protein wouldn't be complete without a carb to accompany it? Garlic mashed it is! The chicken was tender and not dry at all and the lemon caper sauce added a fantastic pizazz to the dish. Garlic mashed potatoes were nothing out of the ordinary, not over powering in the garlic department and I didn't need to add salt so that's always a plus in my book. 

Partner in crime ordered a fillet and though it was a little over cooked around the edges, the "medium" cooked portion of the meat was pretty tasty. I wouldn't say this entree was above and beyond in any way shape or form, but it was good for the price. 

Since I enjoy consumer research in the eating department we decided to quality control the desert menu. Cheese cake "dejour", which ended up being plain cheesecake with strawberry topping on it was delicious. I'm pretty certain their "dejour" is the same every night, but I could be mistaken, haha. 

In any event, if you are looking for an off-strip, casual steak house experience, I would recommend Billy Bob's inside of Sam's Town. 

If you're looking for flashy bells and whistles, stellar service and taste explosions, might want to investigate other options. This joint is great for a low-key evening with out the muss of having to get all gussied up.

Maury is the best server in town. Any opportunity we have to go to Billy Bob's with my Aunt and Uncle we always look forward to seeing Maury.  He's one-of-a-kind. His service is excellent and his humor and wit elevates the entire experience. Hats off to you Maury. Thanks for always going above and beyond (JJ - nephew of Judy & Paul)

Dinner was perfect with Medallion Filet's as the special with baked potato, broccoli and salad for $12.95.  Filet was perfectly grilled and I couldn't believe how tender it was.  YES....i will return when I'm hungry for a steak.

Let me first say that I've been coming to Billy Bob's ever since they opened...many many many years ago!  My last visit on 9/23/15 apprx. 5:15 pm was HORRIFIC!  We made resv. for a booth for 2 people.  When we arrived.....they did not have our reservation!  Told me that they can seat us at a table because the booth's were already reserved for reservations.  I said... "We have a reservation at 5:15 pm for a Booth!"  She continued to say she didn't see our resv. & if we wanted a booth we'd have to wait an hour!  I said forget it...we'll just sit at a table because I'm not waiting an hour! 
Already I was irritated by their incompetence.  My mother and I had a server named Margaret.  She seemed to not really want to be very attentive.  We already knew what we wanted....because we get the same thing everytime we eat here.  King cut prime rib bone-in for $31 each.  We both had the exact order.....Medium rare....baked potato.....blue cheese on salad and 2 diet soda's.  Pretty simple....so we thought.  Our server Margaret brings out our salads.  These were the most pathetic looking salads ever!  Lettuce was warm and wilted...black olives were spoiled and there was hardly any dressing on it & it was on a little side plate.  So far things aren't going well.  We waited to see Margaret again to ask for a FRESH SALAD....but she disappeared!  After about 20 minutes she showed up with our dinner!  And let me tell you....this Prime Rib was absolutely HORRIBLE LOOKING & EVEN MORE HORRIBLE TASTING!  It was gray in color....NOT MEDIUM RARE AT ALL.....it was so TOUGH you couldn't even chew it!!!!!  I am not exaggerating either!  I was so disappointed...I seriously couldn't believe my eyes!  This so called prime rib looked like it was microwaved!!!  I was stunned!!!!  We've eaten this prime rib at least 300 times!  I don't know who was cooking but this prime rib was OLD & DEFINIETLY NOT FRESH!  I can't believe they actually tried to serve something like that for $31!  I wouldn't want to pay $5.95 for it let alone $31!!!
So....here we go again....Where's Margaret?????  Can't find her.....so we will eat our potato until we do.  Finally after about 10-12 minutes we asked the busboy to find our server.  Here she finally comes!  We explained to her that this prime rib is NOT MEDIUM RARE....IT'S WELL DONE & MICROWAVED!  And you can't even chew it!  She said...."Yes it doesn't look right does it?"  We so no....please get us a manager.  Well after another 10 minutes here comes this woman who was the restaurant manager.....we explained to her and she looked at the prime rib and agreed that it DOES NOT LOOK RIGHT.....in "her words"!  She said let me go see what I can find out.  Now we're done with our potato....looking at this inedible meat on our plate......waiting....and waiting.  Here comes Margaret again...she said "Has she fixed your order?"  We said no.....as it sits on our plate still.  She said......the manager should be back soon.  Finally here the manager comes....she says..."I was able to take $10 off your check!"  I ABOUT FLIPPED OUT!!!!!  After all that....she didn't even offer to get us another slice of prime rib?!!!!!!!  Are you kidding me?  WOW!!!!!!  I was so insulted by her response...or lack there of....I could hardly see straight!!!!  She immediately walked away from the table after laying the check folder down with our bill inside on the table.   
I can't believe how unprofessional this entire experience was and how horrible the food was.  I don't know what happened to this place.....but CLEARLY something has changed here!  And the fact that a manager wasn't capable of correcting the disgusting meal with something edible....stuns me even more. 
I think it's time to contact the Food & Beverage Manager.  This was nothing short of robbery!  The gamble shouldn't be on your meal!  That's what the slot machines are for!  When I'm paying hard earned money for a meal....I expect to get what I paid for!  Horrible Horrible Horrible Management, Service from Margaret & INEDIBLE FOOD!!!!

we have been to Billy Bobs several times and had the 5-6 pm special with no
complaints good  food good service.. this visit went to the 9pm special for steak and lobster.
the meal was simpy put horrible..salad was some lettus with 2 cherry tomatoes,steak was gray and barely any grill marks,potatoes were runny but passable .The steak was not hot but luke warm if that..  The lobster was tough . I will say the bread was nice.. We talked to the mngr and he offered us a free desert...... big deal   NO THANKS!!!!took the steak home and gave to the dogs..the atmosphere was nice. reminds you of a lodge in the mts. we usually enjoy the meal there this was really bad,bad, bad!!!!!

Talk about bait and switch. Ads said prime rib dinner $9.99, steak and lobster dinner $11.99, steak and sea food dinner $13.99, etc. So we show up ask for the prime rib dinner, no prime rib dinner here, it's at the buffet... Strike one.  Ok steak and lobster dinner $11.99 ... It's not available until 8pm. Strike two.  Ok, steak and sea food dinner $13.99 ...  We'll that's part of the early bird special.. It's 6 pm - strike three -your out!  No early bird, no late bird, no prime rib. We end up having the queen cut prime rib and the chef's special, orange roughy. This included a soup/salad and bread.  Overall the prime rib was ok a bit over cooked. The roughy was good, although the orange flavor was a bit much after awhile. Bottom line: food was ok but the price was a bit much for what we received. Hoping for the special and getting an overprice meal doesn't give you a good taste in the overall experience.

Sat at table for 10 minutes no service and no one ever stopped to say we'll be right with you... even though there was waite staff present.  We were about to leave when the waiter came. 
I said, "wow we were about to leave."  
The waiter responds, "Okay you can leave if you want".  
OH YES WE LEFT!
You want my $50 for steak and lobster and you behave like this and give this kind of service?  I don't think I'll be paying for you to treat me like this. OH YES WE LEFT!

We ordered the steak and lobster special for $9.99. Great deal, we've been here several times and paid 3 times that amount for one dinner alone so it was quite a deal. The food was good, even though the portions were smaller because of the special. The place wasn't too busy and our server was still forgetful and rude at times. I don't know if we will be back any time soon.

Wee little  steak house inside of Sam's town.   Don't let the exterior fool you! Inside this little steakhouse are all the fixin's found in the big names places.  We had a private room in the back with a 4 course menu.  It was a corporate function so I am not sure of the cost of each entree. We had 19 people and the bill was at about $1000.00 dollars.   The app course consisted of king crab legs, Cajun shrimp, deep fried onion creature, chicken wings (which was excellent). We had a choice 2 soups or a salad. The lobster bisque was great! They had all the usually cuts of meat that you find in a steak house plus a massive prime rib cut. I went with the 8oz filet mignon. It was juicy and tender and stood well on its own without any sort of saucing. Massive deserts ridiculously huge, there really is no need for a piece of cheesecake to be look like it was cut from a wedding cake. All in all pretty good. I would recommend it to others.

Solid.

Pros:
   Good Service
   Nice Ambiance
   Decent Prices
   Great Garlic Mashed Potatoes
   Good Caesars Salad
   Fresh Bread
   All You Can Eat Crab Legs Specials
Cons:
   Just OK Felit Mignon
   No Years on their Wine Selection
   There are definitely better in Vegas

I love my steak medium-rare, seasoned and cooked by Billy Bob's! They do meat just right! I also enjoy the lamb. I regularly stay at Sam's Town Hotel and Casino and make it a point to eat at Billy Bob's at least once while there. They make great soups and I also enjoy the huge sweet potato with side fixings of brown sugar and butter. This monster spud is the size of a hamster! I don't need dessert when I have this side! To be safe, make a reservation and go in hungry!

Early Bird special is very good.  Comes with two filet medallions, baked potato, vegetables soup or salad and bread for $13.99.  That's an excellent deal.  My steaks were cooked perfect.  I opted for salad.  What a great meal but it only is available from 5-6pm.  Been eating at BB for years never once had a bad meal.  

Love the atmosphere.  Especially if you like old west decor.  And Mystic Falls Park just a few feet away.  Yay Sam's Town!


I'm not sure where the bad reviews are coming from.  I have eaten here since 1995.  Never been smoky or had poor service or a bad meal.  Its been in busines a long time for a reason.  I wish I lived closer.

My husband and I usually stay at Sam's Town when we are in Vegas and we've eaten at Billy Bob's several times.  The service has always been good, and the food is good too.  Nice atmosphere for a casino, it's smaller and quiet. They have a small bar area too.  Rustic theme inside.  And if you want to dine on a Friday or Saturday night, best to make a reservation so you don't have too long of a wait.

I'm so glad my friend and I decided to eat at Billy Bob's Steakhouse! The service was quick and efficient.  Everyone we encountered there is nice and friendly,  but professional at the same time.  The food is fantastic.  I had the lemon and herb crusted chicken.  The chicken is savory and cooked to perfection! The vegetables are phenomenal as well. I can't wait to go back.  I highly recommend this place for a wondeful dinner to top off your day!

My husband and I go here every Christmas. This year, was the worst. Our waitress was an older lady, she tried to help us as quickly as she could. The menu changed for the worst. Our dessert took 30 minutes, only because our Lady went on a smoke break, which we could see her leave and come back. She did not even wash her hands. We will be eating elsewhere next year.

It has been 6 years since I've gone to Billy Bob's Steakhouse so I along with my girlfriend decided to go last night because we wanted to try something different plus I felt like spending a little money and get out of our routine of just fast food.  When we arrived it wasn't that busy at all and we didn't need any reservations.  Appetizers were 2 different kinds of bread.  One was raisin bread which I loved.  Since we were there I decided to go expensive and get the 38.00 porterhouse.  Honestly I thought it was going to be bigger.  It reminded me of the 20 dollar steak that Longhorn used to serve.  I also had a salad as well.

We had Calamari that seemed to melt in your mouth.  The calamari was delicious.  I actually liked it better than the steak.  Service was great as well.  Bill came up to be like 83.00.  If I had to do it again I would have gotten something different .  Normally when I spend that much on a steak it usually knocks my socks off to reveal my toenails.  Socks stayed on lol

Dined there tonight, Great Prime Rib, Ribeye, and Ribs.
Food was hot, with large portions.
Huge draft beer, great bargain @ 8.00.
Service was spot on too.
Looking forward to our next visit

Don't go in for the steak and lobster special.  We were treated like it was a bother. The waitress never checked back or refilled drinks.  And you're not offered a baked potato,  just fries or mashed. And the worst part was the steak. No seasoning, and not an open flame grilling that gives steak flavor.
Check our Blueberry Hill Restaurants, a lot more casual than Billy Bob's, but if a good steak you're after, you'll find it there.

Billy Bob's Steakhouse is a true hidden gem. Their food is excellent, not to mention about half the price of what you would pay for the same thing on the strip. The Filet was perfect, the onion soup and the lobster bisque were both excellent. The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is casual. And avoiding the crowds of the strip is a nice benefit too.

I went to Billy Bob's with my brother and his wife.  Everything was good.  (Bread, steak, shrimp, potato, salad, drinks, staff, waitrer, the atmosphere was casual but classy,)  They seated us quickly, attended to our needs, and took coupons that Sams Town provided.  I would recommend this place as a medium price range, enjoyable, dinning experience.

Woot Woot!
I usually have the salmon, but this time I changed it up a bit and had the lamb... Oh man, so flippin good! Huge, big-ol-piece-of-lamb...
My dining guest had the King size prime rib! HAHAHAH! It was seriously the biggest piece of meat I have ever seen (my dogs has 3 meals from the lest overs) I think it was a bit over the top but fab!
I do like it here, they do a great job, the wait staff is very attentive.
It is off the strip (way off) just like I like, parking easy peesy, it is a casino..
I was over the top impressed this trip to Billy Bob's, very good food (it always is)..
Great food, decent pricing. I ordered a beer this time and seriously it was the size of a horses leg (that's a lot of beer my friends) don't know if I will go that route again, but we had fun!
Yummy, don't be fooled by the little Forrest in the middle of the casino, it has it's own little charm..

When Billy Bob's first opened (I guess about 30 years ago), we used to go about once per month.  For  Las Vegas locals, it offered good food at reasonable prices, and a "fun" atmosphere!   We always made a point of treating our out-of-town guests to a dinner at Billy Bobs.  About 20 years ago, after a couple of very LOW QUALITY experiences, we vowed not to ever eat there again!!!  TONIGHT, we broke this vow and decided to give Billy Bob's one more chance! Unfortunately, it was a disappointing mistake.  We each ordered prime rib, with salad and baked potatoes.  The meat was UNBELIEVABLY tough that you couldn't get a knife through, it and the food was served cold.  Each of us sent our dinners back and asked that they be removed from our bill.  We did, however, enjoy the different bread selections that came in a basket to our table and, as always, the wolf and waterfall show was special treat.   It's such a shame that what was once a good place to and a great place to visit will be WRITTEN OFF on our lives forever!

Hi. I had a horrible time at this restaurant. I used to love this place and they ruined it for me. They couldn't get the porterhouse cooked right. First, they switched the Temps on my prime rib and her portehouse, so her porterhouse came out med rare and my prime rib came out med well. They turned to fix it and couldn't get her porterhouse cooked right. Finally, they just offered to take the porterhouse off the check. I would hope so! It wasn't eaten at all. This whole experience was crap. The only reason I'm giving them three stars is because of the busses edgar. He did an amazing job. He truly made the experience bearable.

smokey. open to casino. 
We came here to celebrate two birthdays. Now I wouldn't think that sams town would have had that tropical little area with the water and light show. and the howling wolf.                             

I
but again, the restaurant was too smoke filled.. isn't that again Nevada (las vegas) laws or something.. So it smelled not good.  It was nice and open but that smoke was just no good. especially for a table full of non smokers.   We decided to do the surf n turf, steak and lobster..  $10 I think it was . The meat was so over cooked and dry, i didn't try the lobster tho. but everyone seemed to enjoy that. The plate of oysters was a little overpriced but still tasty none the less. Not sure that i will be returning. our waiter was friendly but a bit too busy to notice we had empty beverage cups..

Somewhat disappointed. Wife and I ate here for the first time on New Year's eve. First, no greeting from our server like "Hi, welcome to Billy Bob's. I'm Mark and I'll be your server this evening." Second, we ordered a bottle of Champagne only to find out that they ran out of Asti. Who runs out of bottles of Champagne on New Year's eve ? Third, I ordered lobster and the presentation was terrible The lobster was small and not served in or on the shell but just laid on the plate next to a baked potato that wasn't even cut opened (wife's potato was the same). Fourth, when the drawn butter for the lobster was served, we were informed that they ran out of candles to keep it warm...again, who does that onNew Year's eve. Lastly, the server was short with us all night and just not very friendly. On the plus side, the food was delicious. Oysters Rockefeller - wonderful. Wife's rib eye - cooked to medium rare perfection and lobster - very good. 

I guess we'll give this place another chance if we stay in the hotel but wouldn't go out of our way just to eat here.

At that price point, better server training and management is needed. Customer service as well as drink availability and food presentation are the key to success.

My husband and I fell in love with this place.
The bar is nice very romantic, lights are dim so it gives it a relaxing environment. I love the country music playing softly in the background. The beer was cold and very tasty :) we didn't have time to eat there but it is definitely on our list. Everyone was very nice I can't wait to go back.

Big portions and food is very good. Prices are reasonable. Atmosphere is cowboy rustic...which not everyone will like...but if you want a decent steak dinner, without going to a high end steakhouse, this place will suit your needs.

WAITRESS FROM HELL!!!
It started out great we were seated giving our menus. We were looking over them. Everyone was ready to order there, selected item on the menu. My fiance asked the older gentleman who was our busser to grab the waiter/ waitress 4 times. We sat there and waited quite a long time. The busser brings our drinks to the table gets everything right but mine. Our waitress comes to the table "finally." (Attitude from "the get go.") Blonde short curly hair older woman totally rude!!!!! This was my 1st time here, and it was for my birthday. What a nightmare she ruined my birthday. As I started eating my food that comes. I asked her kindly. "What the sauce was in the canister." I've never ate here before? She told me. I asked her again nicely for something else like ranch. Then I think she got offended. She was very rude after, our friends who went with us, asked for an extra plate. She lost it in a rude voice saying "WAIT A MINUTE IM NOT DONE." Rudely puts another plate on the table.... I was shocked. That a person so rude could possibly work at this very nice establishment. I sat there for around 15 mins holding my Tounge till I snapped. I went up to a different waiter, and asked for a manager. I was so angry borderline crying tears. The manger came out, and I talked to him outside because I did not want to create a scene. He said, "He was sorry that he would talk to this very rude employee." I thought he would remove some items from the check. I asked him to please get me another waitress. He said, "He would." 3 other people came to our table. They were nice, we asked several times for the check in fact our friends, and my man wanted to walk out. It was taking forever for our check to come. If I could say anything good about this place. "It has amazingly great food." We got our check finally from Toni I'm assuming the manager. "THE WAITRESS FROM HELL," name was not on our check. I saw the manager removed one item from the check. (My personal opinion, I think the meal should have been comped. "THE WAITRESS FROM HELL." Should have been told to go home.) This was the worst experience, I've ever had at a restaurant. that is so classy ... sheer disappointment!!!!!!!!
The service was friendly, the food was great, and the atmosphere is just right for a date night.  No complaints from me.  If you come to Sam's Town, try Billy Bob's.

Had dinner there last night. Had prime rib special at $12.99 (have to buy beverage too). It was mediocre, nothing special. Drinks were very good.  Staff was efficient and friendly. We only picked this place because we were staying in a campground close by and could walk here. Did not find casino very exciting.

This ties for my fave restaurant in Las Vegas, my other one I will review when I am motivated to stand in line for an hour (that review is coming) every meat is cooked to perfection, from the chicken, the steak and the pork, ive tried it all and it was fantastic! the king crab app is a bargain, large comfy booths, my only small complaint is it always seems chilly in there but thats about it!

We always eat at Billy Bob's at least once during each vacation.

It's a very casual Steak House and the food is hearty.

On this night, instead of usual Rib Eye my husband and I decided to try something different.

My husband went with the Salmon filet and baked yams, while I ordered the bone in pork chop.

My husband enjoyed the salmon, it was moist.

I enjoyed the pork chop, had it cooked medium and it was moist.  (thank you to Ivan at Alder & Birch for telling me a new way to have pork chops)

Desert is always amazing at Billy Bob's. This time around we had the Death by Chocolate with coffee.

Oh my gosh......just awesome.

Now if only they would bring back those Foot long eclairs then they would be perfect!

lol

Hubby gives a 4 and so do I

A little pricey, but the food is good. 
They start out with this basket of sourdough bread and a cranberry nut bread that is very good!!!!
Then I ordered the Chicken Oscar. Unfortunately, I filled up on bread and salad and was completely full by the time the meal came.  
Although I got it to go, I did take a bite while it was hot and fresh in order to tell all you fine yelpers how it was....and it was good, of course.  LOL! 
The garlic mash potatoes were nice and garlicky, and the chicken was cooked perfectly with a great bern
I was just too full on the yummy bread to eat any more than my taste.  Togo box!
I would definitely come back.

Over the years, I've eaten at Billy Bob's 20 or 25 times.  It's close to my house, offers great food without being overly fancy, and has always had good service.  The last 2 times we were there, we were disappointed with our overall experiences, but not disappointed enough to complain about it.  It was just "meh."

Tonight we decided to try it again, and it will be the last time.  I will not be back.  We started with breads, and I asked the busboy if he could get me some butter that was softened, because I could not get my knife through the frozen butter in front of me to spread it on my bread.  He said, "no problem" and that's the last I saw him until he dropped desserts on our table an hour later.  

We ordered salads.  We both requested that the salads be tossed, and again, we were told, "no problem."  She dropped the salads at our table a bit later, and they were ranch soup with some wilted lettuce and croutons floating in it - they clearly had not been tossed - just drenched in dressing.  Next came the French onion soup, which was burned.  The cheese on top was blackened, and yet the waitress sat it on our table anyway.  I tried.  I really tried to stomach it, but they burned the cheese so bad it burned the onions under it.  It took me 5 tries and almost 15 minutes before I could flag the waitress down and have her replace it.  

When our entrees came, the garlic potatoes were more garlic and salt than they were potatoes, the prime rib was bubble gum chewy, and the vegetables were somehow both wilted and crunchy.  It was one of the worst meals I've had in a long time.  

We opted to try dessert as we were both still a little hungry, so we ordered a crme brule.  I LOVE crme brule, and Billy Bob has great crme brule - or at least they did until today.  The brule was blackened, which created a smoky flavor in the crme, and the texture was more of a pudding than a light airy crme dessert.  It was overcooked by almost double.  

As we were trying to eat the dessert and picking the most offensive of the burned crust from the top, the manager walked by.  "You are picking off the best part."  I informed her that we both love brule, but this one is burned pretty bad and overcooked, and then informed her of the other problems we had with our meal.

Her reply was, "Oh, that sucks.  I'll have to see who is making them today," and then she walked off.  No apology, no offer to replace it, no offer to take it off the bill...nothing.  I understand that mistakes happen in the restaurant industry.  We are all human.  But to be a restaurant manager, be informed by a guest that their meal and dessert were sub-par (in parts inedible), and then just walk off with a "That sucks?"  Yes.  It does suck.  It sucks to pay $60 or $70 for food that you cannot eat - with service that is worse than Denny's.  It sucks for you that you will not get any more of my business...because despite years of great meals, you are now destroying your reputation, and driving your customers away.

When I think of Billy Bob's Steak House, that 1965 oldie "5 O' Clock World"  by the Vogues plays in my head. That is because it's a 5 O' clock world when Billy Bob's opens for business in style with an hour long $12.99 prime rib special that ends at 6 o' clock. 

  Billy Bob's $12.99 prime rib special is a nice deal that includes a large serving of prime rib with a choice of potato and salad. With a beverage, tax, and tip; the $12.99 prime rib special adds up to $20. Still a good deal. 

  On a recent visit to Sam's Town, I saw the advertisement for the $12.99 prime rib special. I had to go back to try it. After hiking in Wetlands Park, I treated myself to a post hike dinner at Billy Bob's. 

Service: 

    Throughout the dining experience the waiter was friendly and on top of the Coke refills. Fine service from seating myself to paying the check. 

Ambience: 

   Billy Bob's is a fun restaurant to dine in. My patio seat was in Mystic Falls Park, Sam's Town's Disneyesque park under an atrium reflecting real sunlight where audio autotronic animals entertain the guests. My table would be a nice spot to take in the laser show. And it isn't everyday, where you are enjoying prime rib to look up and see a realistic bear growling as he looks your way at the same time that birds chirp away, and a waterfall cascades into a Disneyesque park. My table was also along the walking path through the perimeter of Mystic Falls Park. Billy Bob's is also a casual restaurant to dine in. The dining room beyond the bar is dimly lit creating a different environment from Mystic Falls Park. 

Prime rib dinner:

    I was satisfied with the prime rib dinner. After hours of hiking, the $12.99 prime rib tasted like a million bucks. The portions were both quality and quantity. This also included the salad. Now the baked potato with both sour cream and butter could of been a meal in itself. Finally the prime rib, as the picture proceeding the review shows, was large, thick, and juicy. Regardless of a few Swiss cheese shaped spots of fat, I'd give the prime rib four stars. 

Return factor:

   Billy Bob's won me over with two things that I enjoy when dining out: delicious food at a fair price and an upbeat dining environment. Mix the upbeat Disneyland environment of Mystic Falls Park with a tasty prime rib special, oh he'll yeah I'm a fan. I cannot guarantee it, but sometime in the future I am leaning toward returning for the steak and shrimp special. Now if I could only get that song "5 O' Clock World" out of my head.
The service was friendly. We enjoyed the early bird special: prime rib dinner. It was excellent and the price was outstanding. We will be back to try more items!

Wow...this place was a perfect setting for my sister-in-law's Birthday dinner. Lovely place...very much like a quiet cabin. We had a real splurge and enjoyed oysters Rockefeller, lamb, pork chops, porterhouse steak, butternut squash soup, brownie ice cream, and a foot long eclair...yes, I said a foot long eclair. :) Everything was delicious and large portions so we could not finish it all but we sure did try. 

Service was excellent and we were treated very well. 

For those interested, the fresh brewed iced tea was very good. :)

Really a wonderful evening.

I am only giving this one star because I'm assuming I have to give at least one. I just had the worst steak I have ever ordered. I can't comprehend how anyone can prepare a steak with absolutely ZERO flavor. I had to try to eat it with the dry, bland, allegedly garlic mashed potatoes and it was still atrocious!  DO NOT waste your hard earned money on this place...

Atmosphere was great. That was the first thing I noticed. When sat, we were greated by an older gentleman (our busser), who took our drink order. Our drinks were served promptly, then a few minutes later, our server Matt arrived. He was the man. He was very professional and thorough. He took great care of my mother, who is 84 years old, and made her feel very special. That is rare in Las Vegas, in my opinion. The only complaint I have is that the salad wasn't the freshest and my prime rib was a little chewy. I will definitely return.

The bad : Raw oysters were frozen. Ribeye steak was unseasoned and over cooked. Bread basket was ok but butter was cold and hard.  
The good : blue cheese filet was very good. Service was borderline slow but excellent as far as personality of the staff. The staff quickly made right the overcooked steak by bringing a properly cooked replacement  and at the end of the meal brought us a complimentary HUGE piece of chocolate cake. 
Overall : service good. Food eh.

We learned the hard way that tank tops are not allowed. We ended up buying a shirt at the gift shop. Our waiter, Jonathan, was awesome - great service. My husband and I had the Tequila Lime Shrimp appetizer and shared the generous - size Filet Mignon. Food was good and they cooked our steak just right.

I love this place! I have been coming here for 15 years, at least. It is consistant in the quality of prime rib and you always leave with leftovers. The prices are affordable for a prime rib joint, and their giant chocolate eclair is a special treat!

As a solid local I must say I really like this restaurant.  The cocktails are great and the Prime Rib which I go for is some of the best in the valley!  If you have a good appetite get the bone in -- fantastic!!  Ribs too are great and their specials can not be beat!  Service can be spotty which is a downer.  Get reservations particularly if you want an early dinner.  This place is a favorite with the early dining older crowd.

Fine dining my arse! This place would not even qualify as a decent diner! 
We were tired and hungry after our flight into vegas and did not want to venture from the hotel. Our dining experience here made us adventurous, as no way would we trust another restaurant at this hotel/casino, if this is their best restaurant.

So let the dining adventure begin...we are seated promptly, that earned the one and only star for this place. Our table is one of only a few occupied tables in our dining area. We see a couple of people who appear to be taking home their entire meal uneaten into to go containers. We found this curious.

We sat and sat and sat and sat....after 20 minutes a waitress comes. We order a bottle of wine, and although we are ready to order our meal. She leaves without taking our order. 10 minutes later we get a bread basket and inquire about our wine. We are rudely told it is coming. 

I do not know what kind of bread this was supposed to be, but it was nasty! Horrible smelling, horrible tasting. Really tested our gag reflexes to the limit. Like the mother dough went bad but they kept using it. Super gag!

Salad and soup come, still no wine, but of course we are assured it is coming. Honey's salad was major fail, however, my chicken tortilla soup was the highlight of the meal. Of, course there was no edible bread to dunk into said yummy soup. 

At last the wine arrives, hallelujah, praise the lord! But, wait, what is this? Oh no, no, no...it cannot be! They put the st. Michelle's Merlot in a chiller! The server then proceeds to open the bottle and pour full glasses! No simple pour to taste that the wine is not corked. Major faux pas in our part of the world.

So as we try to bring the wine down to a reasonable temperature by cradling the wine glasses with our hands, dinner finally arrives, mind you we are almost at 1.5 hour mark since being seated. Fillet mignon and prime rib, both are chewy and unsatisfying to say the least.

This is one of those places where quantity is more prevalent than quality. More food seems to leave in doggy bags than gets eaten. Service was exceedingly horrible. This was our nightmare vegas dining experience by far. Go anywhere but here!

I had the king cut prime rib. I skipped the bread from reading the reviews. Clan chowder was average at best. Prime rib should have been medium, was close to well done, so sen pack and was perfect. Quality of meet was not the highest, it was tough. Broccoli and carrots were cold. Service was good and atmosphere was nice.

This place was okay, portions were big.. I had the prime rib, baked potato and lobster bisque soup.  The soup had a big chunk of lobster in it which was a pleasant surprise but the actual bisque was a little on the salty side.  Had a good taste to it, creamier bisque, was good.  The baked potato was good, who could mess that up and the prime rib was cooked good, just wasn't as tender as I'm used to.. flavor was lacking, bland.  Waiter was real flamboyant, told us he was the waiter, cashier and I think he said even did some of the cooking.. he was attentive but a smart a$$..

Holy cow! Great steaks and a good selection of single malt scotch. If you are not a BIG eater, don't go here. Huge portions are served here and the service is not bad. Since it's at Sam's Town, it's kind of out of the way. But worth it. 
Prices not bad either.

Was staying on the strip and was really craving steak. Of course everything within the vicinity was like at least $50 for tiny ass lil steak not inclusive of sides. Did some research in the tourist magazines and found this affordable steak house. about 15-20 minutes away from the strip, but his place is amazing. Although we paid $30's for our meal, my prime rib was huge! Not to mention it came with a giant baked potato. Salad was great and we definitely had leftovers. The nice thing is this place is casual so you don't feel like your trying to be all fake and fancy like the other places on the strip. Sam's town had evening entertainment with their lightshow, so it was definitely a good time and nice walkoff of that filling delicious meal. I will definitely be back when I'm back in vegas again.
Finally Got around to stop by for the bacon wrapped shrimp. It was GOOD!

I'm a Vegas local and this used to be one of my favorite places to go...but recently, they brought in a new Food and Beverage manager and he is a certified douche bag! Rude, impersonal, and trying to do too much to "justify his job!" Too many things have changed that makes it an unpleasant experience to visit...increased prices and smaller food portions/drinks pours (the wine pours in these new unnecessary little carafes are ridiculous at best).  We've been going to this place 2 - 3  times a week religiously for the past 10 years and I am not a fan of how things are going now. Besides the fact that he stands around and stares at the customers and employees, eats in there frequently and gives the employees a hard time when he does,  he doesn't take the time to speak to the customers and get to know ANYONE...especially the regulars that KEEP HIM EMPLOYED! Previous FandB managers have been very personal and have taken the time to get to know the people that are always there...made them, us, feel special, appreciated...like a good manager does!  He spends all his time seemingly TRYING to find something wrong with a restaurant that has been running smooth and has been a great environment for YEARS. I'm uncomfortable going in there and I don't even work for this guy!!! I can only imagine how uncomfortable the employees are! Someone at Sam's Town needs to make a change or regulars are going to stop coming in...and places like this NEED regulars to stay afloat when it's not tourist season.

We went here for the prime rib special so we had to wait till after 9 PM; which we did.  We were promptly seated and greater by our waitress; if you can call it that.  She was rude from the start and told us that we needed a special card to get the prime rib special and were directed to the casino lobby.  But it was her attitude that made us just leave and go elsewhere for dinner.

We went here tonight as we saw a movie and wanted to grab a bite before. We chose this venue as the hotel described it as the only formal restaurant and that it had a Zagat rating that was good. I ordered the oysters to begin with. The oysters were fresh, but only came with shrimp sauce and no other specific condiments. I ordered the pasta Pomodoro with chicken breast. I can make better pasta than this restaurant can. The dish was pitiful. The salad that came with it before was plain and nothing to write home about. The best part of the whole meal was the Pinot Noir wine by the glass that I ordered. My friend ordered the prime rib and said it was good but far from the best steak she's ever had. Overall, I was disappointed.

The service was good and the restaurant is very plain and appropriate looking for a steakhouse. The prices were fair. With that, I still do not plan on going back here.

I have been to Billy Bob's off and on for the last few years, but haven't been here in about two years..  Since I am relatively new to Yelp as I am writing this review, I'll make this review about tonight's meal.  Now, with that said, I have never had a bum meal here.  Every time I have come here it has been aces.  

So, here is the experience that my family and I had during this visit:

1.  I decided to read some of the previous reviews to see if anything may have changed.  There were some unpleasant reviews and to be honest, it kind of worried me.  But, since this is my sisters favorite place, we decided to give it a try.  

2.  As I was looking at Billy Bob's homepage here on Yelp, I saw a link where I could make a reservation.  So, I decided to trust it and made the click.  About 10 - 15 minutes later there was a confirmation waiting for me in my email.  

3.  We decided to show up a little earlier than the time of our reservation.  I got to the front desk and asked if we could sit a little earlier.  "No problem... please follow me".   

4.  Now, I am a clean freak and a bit of a germaphobe.  So, I went  to wash up.  This is where I deduct a star.  The sink area was absolutely soaked and the paper towels were sitting on top.  I have changed many paper towel dispensers and it's not that hard.  So, someone must have dropped the ball here.  

5.  As I came back to the table, the complimentary bread and butter was delivered.  The motto in my family is "IF IT'S FREE, TAKE 2".  So needless to say we had 2 servings of the bread.  Now here is my tip "Don't load up on bread 'cause you'll never finish your meal."

6.  Our drinks were always fresh... And our waiter (Derrick)  gave us ample amount of time to look at our menus.  He was right there when we were ready.  

7.  Our meals were timed well.  We had our salad's and soup well before our meals came out.  The food came out hot and to order.  We ate as much as we could but still had to get boxes to take home.  He brought the bill after a dessert pitch.  

It was an enjoyable dining experience.

Came back here again for their night owl special, wanting to try it again. The first time we sat waiting for 30 minutes for a table and then told we needed to sit at the bar if we wanted to eat. The food was mediocre and the bartender didn't really have much interest since we weren't buying alcohol. When the bill came, I asked the bartender if he needed to see my players card for the special and he said "no, we really don't care about that". Fast forward a few months to today. 

Opentabled a reservation and was seated in seconds. Great start! Walking to be seated, everyone in the place was having the steak and lobster special; must be good. Bus boy takes our drink order, and our server, Debbie, comes over to take our order. Of course she asked what we were drinking since apparently the staff doesn't really communicate with each other. Both of us ordered the special. First I was told that I had to order a beverage, since I was drinking water. That's fine, charge me for a soda; I wasn't drinking water to be cheap. She finished taking my order and my significant other proceeds to order the same thing. She tells us to pull out individual players cards for the special. Really? I've been patronizing this hotel with my family for over 20 years, and have never been told this before. If you go to the buffet with 4 people, do they ask for 4 cards? Whatever Debbie, be a company girl. You sold your $35 filet tonight, which is what my SO ordered. 

While waiting, another party sits next to us in Debbie's section and orders the special. Person #3 didn't have their player card on them, so good ole Debbie sends them back to their room to go get it! At least she's consistent?

Food comes. Whoever is throwing the steaks in the oven needs a lesson on how to cook them. Or maybe it's because their "special" steak, which is about as thick as a piece of cardboard, cooks in seconds. Either way, I ordered it medium rare and got medium well, pushing on well. Of course the $35 filet comes out perfect medium rare. Irony? Probably not. 

The bus boy came over a few times to refill drinks and clear plates. Debbie made an appearance to try to sell some dessert, which obviously was a no-go. Left quickly and will not be returning.

I have to admit, I was pleasantly surprised by Billy Bob's.

We come to Sam's Town every Saturday night to enter our picks for their football contest.  On my way to work every night, I pass a billboard on the 95 that advertises steak and lobster for $11.99.

So, on this particular Saturday night, we decided to stop in for dinner after playing bingo.  I am not sure of the restaurant's hours, but we got there just about 10pm.  We inquired with the hostess about the special and she explained the details:

- guests must be a players club member and present their card before ordering
- guests must purchase a beverage
- guests must be over 21

Since we met all of those criteria, we were quickly sat at a nice table.  The atmosphere overall is nice.  There are tables and booths and a large bar.  Our server was very friendly (I don't recall her name).

Considering this special is $11.99, I wasn't particularly expecting much.  I tend to do this so I don't find myself disappointed.  We were served a basket of bread, and also started with our choice of soup or salad.  I had my salad with bleu cheese, my Dad with ranch, and my Mom had the soup - lobster bisque.  The salads were typical (not in a bad way).  The soup was really good, it had chunks of lobster in it and great flavor.  My Mom was very pleased with it.

With the meal, you also get a choice of side (rice, potato, fries, etc).  Both Mom and Dad had garlic mashed and I had rice pilaf.  We all ordered our steaks medium rare, and mine was done perfectly, but there was definitely some inconsistency with the other 2 (my Dad's was more medium well and my Mom's medium).  Also, this is not the biggest piece of meat you will ever see, but paired with the lobster tail and side, it was plenty of food.

We were all stuffed and my parents admitted that they thought it was too good to be true!  Well, it wasn't - when we got our bill, it was just about $50 for the 3 of us.  They each had coffee and I had a glass of wine - can't beat that!

Note: This special is ONLY available from 8pm-Close.  This is clearly listed on the billboard I saw.  I also would never just sit down at a table to order without having asked in advance.  The hostess was happy to answer any questions we had.  I don't consider this a "bait and switch." It's a late night special, offered to players club members.  

I would DEFINITELY go back for this meal again!

This place is good.I went for x-mas eve dinner once. Lets get things straight though. Its not a gourmet room! It serves good quality steak, but its not a stuffy atmosphere of a high end steak house. I came a bit overdressed the first time and felt like a dumb ass when I saw people in tourist shirts and fanny paks. 
Decent food. A bit high priced, but i DID enjoy my meal. Had no problems with the service. 
I would go again, but I would dress more casual.

i had to dock this place one whole star because they are a vegas lifetime away from anything else I can imagine I'd be interested in, but the faux forest at Sam's Town in which Billy Bob's is located is kinda cool in a really odd sort of way (there 's a huge waterfall with a roaring bear. totally NOT weird). In any case, our server was great. Exactly the type of seasoned professional I want serving me at any dining facility, and especially in vegas. The bread basket wasn't outstanding, nor was the salad, but for what we paid, we got a LOT of food and the meat, which is really what we went for, was cooked just right. I split the 24oz porterhouse with my fiance and added a side of asparagus but we also got a mambo  sweet potato, which was our choice over a baked or fries. i think that cost us a whopping total of like less than $30! serio, amazing. and whle the porterhouse didn't blow my mind, my soon-to-be father-in-law (too many dashes..) got the ribeye and WOW. mind blown. seuper taaasty. and the beers are cheap and the sc game was on nearby. everyone won.
though that was the only time the entire trip :( good thing we ate for cheap while we could still pay for food.

Took about ten minutes before we saw our waiter after we were sat. We ordered a ribeye and prime rib. For the amount of money you charge for the steak, you could at least put a rub or something on it before you put it on the grill. The lobster was a bit overcooked but not so much it lost its flavor. This place used to be much better. What happened?

Tasty non-pretentious Prime Rib hit the spot!

We were spending some quality family time at Sam's town and it was time to eat right away. We were able to stroll right in here at 9pm and cozy up in a booth with some tasty salads and prime rib. The salads were fresh and delicious and the prime rib tender and flavorful. It was less expensive than most vegas dining and I really enjoyed that I could roll on in here in casual attire. 

The complimentary bread was also especially tasty. 

My sweetheart did not like the naming of the prime rib cuts as "queen" and "king". That was kind of sexist. Otherwise we agreed it was pretty awesome.

Pre-cooked, then thawed and warmed and served fare.
Tasteless and dry.
No inspiration, no quality, no flavor,, this place sucks from the cold dry stale bread, to the crappy steaks.
Like most everything else at Sams Town,, the food here sucks.
Good service so one extra star.

Go elsewhere,, anywhere, even Outback has this joint beat.

When at Sam's Town its hard to find a Guinness but this Steak House was always my go to as its pretty much in the middle of the casino and the bartenders are always friendly, quick, and on point.

Our last staycation there was our first time actually eating inside. Be fore warned that you need to come hungry. The portions are HUGE. If you are a snacker resist the urge to eat the delicious bread and butter they put out for you (You will thank me later).

As I mentioned the Prime Rib portion was huge, of barely fit on the plate. Its scary but we had ordered the 2nd biggest cut they had. Flavor was top notch on it and she will be happy to order it again. Our other dish was was their seafood pasta. It had fresh and plentyfull seafood I could have eaten it all night. The dish was advertised as spicy but it barely had any bite. I would be happy to order it again asking they kick up the spicy level a bit.

Our server was top notch and always there to bring a fresh drink or offer something different to try.

Delicious!! We started with the seared scallops, lobster bisque soup and some bread that was so good:) I had the petite fillet minion and my husband had the prim rib. They were perfectly cooked to order. We both had garlic mashers. Yummy...my mouth is still watering. Billy Bobs is a must!! We had no complaints service was awesome.

My husband and I were there on Sunday 8/9/15. Didn't know what to expect because of the name. But when I saw they had scallops and steak. Thought we would give it a try, and glad we did. The ambience is nice and soothing. Loved the old rustic feel. Great music. My husband had the filet mignon and they made it to his perfection. I had the steak w asparagus and sauce which was great. The service was great! Wish I could remember the waitresses name. She was very attentive,made sure we were pleased with everything. Would definitely  come again. Food was great and inexpensive .

We went last night for Valentines day and I felt embarrassed for making the arrangements there as the experience was awful. We booked through Open Table over a week prior and was given a confirmation, so you would think that it wouldn't take close to 15 minutes for them to find our reservation when we arrived.

We were then sat in Carlos section. Took awhile for us to be greeted and then My mother in law ordered water with lemon, no lemons were given. But hey no big deal! We all ordered steaks and it comes with a starch and salad. Felt the pricing was good for what's included compared to other steak houses.

Salads arrived, only table not given croutons, but then again, that is not anything to really complain about! Main courses were delivered and waiter said he will stop by in just a few to make sure everything was ok. Well we didn't receive the extra side dishes we ordered, steaks were under seasoned, and over cooked. The waiter, nor anyone else checked by or was in the vicinity to let them know. So we just ate our mediocre food, the waiter finally came by as we were finished to ask if we wanted a box. Also refills on drinks... Forget about it!!

Getting a box was another 10 minute wait, and then getting the check was about another 10 minutes. Of course the check also reflected all the food we never received. The bill was corrected though and we then left.

Being that I have been in the service industry for many years, I can honestly say that I can tolerate a lot of errors or oversight by wait staff or kitchen as places can get busy. Not one aspect of this dinner was acceptable and the server didn't even seem that busy with other tables. 

Really sad about this as the restaurant has great potential.
